result.execSummary:
The defendant John C Krumenacher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Apply 23 days sentence credit, if revoked.
Concurrent with: Cases 15CM246 & 15CM722.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied.  PAID IN FULL.  Court waives DNA surcharge.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
No contact with Pick N Save.
Cases 15CM668 and 15CM770 were dismissed and read in.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.
Apply 70 days sentence credit.
Concurrent with: Cases 15CM246 and 15CM722.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
Probation revoked.  Sentence imposed.

Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant John C Krumenacher in court, in custody, with attorney Kevin Brian Dunn.  

State presented their recommendations.
Defense presented their recommendations.

Court orders the following:
180 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
70 Days Credit.
Concurrent to:  15CM246 & 15CM722

Any outstanding costs/fines/surcharges can be converted to a civil judgment.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 02-24-2016 01:45 pm

ADDRESS INFO for John C Krumenacher
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 01-28-2016)
Prior: 200 N Brookfield Rd, Brookfield, WI 53045
with attachments filed by Department of Corrections.
Letter to defendant from court denying his request at this time to go to Mexico for his niece's wedding.

Filed by the Defendant, requesting the court allow him to travel out of the country to Mexico for his niece's wedding from 06/20/16 - 06/27/16.
12/29/15 - Court reviewed would allow if no violations between now and June.
01/06/15 - Based on notification of the defendant being in custody on 12/29/15 for a PO HOLD for a PO Violation of drinking court denies the request to leave the country at this time.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.  
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form filed.

Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant John C Krumenacher in court with attorney Benjamin T Van Severen. 
Case called along with:  15CM246, 15CM668, 15CM722 & 15CM770.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.


Court orders the following:
SENTENCE WITHHELD.
23 Days Credit - IF REVOKED.

Term of Probation: 2 Years.
Concurrent to:  15CM246 & 15CM722
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
No Contact with:  Pick N Save.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Costs: $243
DNA SURCHARGE:  Court Waives.
Apply Bail and Refund the Balance to the Posting Party.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 5, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant John C Krumenacher in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Benjamin T Van Severen.
